subject: Re: [junit] TestNG 4 and Data Providers
msgSnippet: ... Point taken :-) Still, I think this is a different topic. Having a meaningful failure message is orthogonal to whether this test method received parameters
messageBody:
On 10/12/05, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
>
> Is this thing on?
>
> NOT ALL ASSERTIONS ARE assertEquals()!
>
> If I just get AssertionFailedError at line 23 because assertNotNull()
> failed, I have /no idea/ which row of test data caused that failure.
>
> That said, test names is the way I usually solve this problem. I admit
> there are other solutions, but if you don't let me give you a test name,
> then you /force/ me to use a failure message (to display, for example,
> enough input data to distinguish one test from another) when I otherwise
> wouldn't have needed one. More work than necessary.


Point taken :-)

Still, I think this is a different topic. Having a meaningful failure
message is orthogonal to whether this test method received parameters or
not.

Once in a while, I will bother adding a failure message in the assert, but
most of the time, I don't and if there's a failure, I need to dig in anyway
so the stack trace is usually good enough to get me started.

Again, I'm not ruling out adding test names to Data Providers, just taking
things one step at a time in order to see how users will use this feature.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
